description.value: You've spent enough time on fire that you know how to use it to your advantage. You can light yourself thoroughly on fire with a held torch, a bottle of alchemist's fire, or a similar incendiary, dealing yourself [[/r {1d6}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}. As long as you are suffering @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage}, all your melee attacks against adjacent creatures deal an additional 1 fire damage per weapon damage die. Any creature that successfully @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Grapple]{Grapples}, @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Shove]{Shoves}, or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Trip]{Trips} you takes 1d6 fire damage; if it uses a weapon for that action, the weapon takes the damage instead. You must still attempt the flat check to remove the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Fire Damage} each round, as normal.
